addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable S
r
Francis Walsingham knight, Principall Secretary to her Ma
tie
.

ult
o
Octobris
1589
From M
r
Bodley: an appendix to that of the 30 of the same.
Count Mansfeld
besegeth
e sconces about
Rees.
Yo
r
letter said to be w
th
out her
M
t
privitie
e said cavil answered.
Count Hollocks
thankfull accept
a
ce of comendati
o
s.

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
H. after deliverie of my
former to this bearer, we were advertised
that
e Count Charles Maunsfelt w
t
2000
footmen, and 7 cornet of horse, besiegeth
e
sconce about Rees, whiche is but weake, and
ill provided of necessaries to make resistance.
The Deputies are newly returned out of
En-gland
, but have made no report as yet to
e state of their negotiation: untill when, I
shall have no opportunitie to solicit for
Vasseur.
If it came not hither by their informac
o
n,
at
her Ma
tie
was not acquainted w
t
that letter
whiche yo
r
H. sent me last in his behalf, it
proceeded from some other of their Agents. Forone of their owne assemblie, and of
e chiefest
told me flatly,
at they knowe of yo
r
H. letter
before it came, and they were advertised
at
it was w
t
out her Ma
ties
privitie. Wherto I
made suche answear, as I thought their childish
proceeding required. For mine owne part
I did never thinke it possible to have so many
and so grosse imperfections in men so continually
practised in affaires of importance, as I
see both daily and hourely in all their courses
w
t
her Ma
tie
. Count Hollocke doth
take yo
r
H. commendac
o
ns and message
in very kinde part, w
ch
I delivered to
at purpose as
M
r
Tomson
signified in a
Postscript.
And so I take my humble
leave. Fr
o
e Hage. Oc
t
31.
89. Yo
r
H. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley.
